channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Ford Will Take $19.5 Billion Hit as It Rolls Back E.V. Plans
item.description: Ford Motor said the costs come from its decision to make fewer electric vehicles than it had planned and more hybrids that use both gasoline engines a...

item.title: Trump’s Post Attacking Rob Reiner After Stabbing Death Draws Immediate Outrage
item.description: The president attributed the killing of Rob Reiner and his wife to “Trump derangement syndrome.” There was no indication that the couple’s political b...

item.title: Trump vows to fight ‘fraud’ in SNAP benefits for 42 million Americans
item.description: “It's always something that goes wrong,” Jamal Brown, a 41-year-old food stamp participant said, “unfortunately.”

item.title: How Tech’s Biggest Companies Are Offloading the Risks of the A.I. Boom
item.description: The data centers used for work on artificial intelligence can cost tens of billions to build. Tech giants are finding ways to avoid being on the hook ...

item.title: Rivian CEO says the EV maker’s new large driving model will one day allow for fully autonomous driving—and maybe a spot in the robotaxi race
item.description: “Our initial focus will be on personally owned vehicles," RJ Scaringe said. But "this also enables us to pursue opportunities in the rideshare space."

item.title: ‘We are now firmly back in a good is bad/bad is good regime’: Weak job data may lead to more rate cuts and boost stocks, Morgan Stanley economist says
item.description: Morgan Stanley’s top strategist Michael Wilson noted the labor market, more so than inflation, has become a crucial factor in determining future monet...

item.title: Small businesses say Trump tariffs are hurting this group of consumers this holiday season—here’s what is getting more expensive
item.description: Consumers' estimated gift budgets decreased $229 between October and November, according to a Gallup index.

item.title: Former Meta integrity chief says new report reveals ‘disappointing’ ad fraud epidemic at the social-media giant
item.description: An internal audit warned of systemic corruption, yet Meta expanded Chinese ad partnerships that generated billions—much of it tied to fraud.

item.title: Ukraine and Allies Agree on Security Guarantee for Peace Proposal
item.description: Crucial details on the future security of Ukraine remain unsettled as negotiators seek a deal that Russia will approve.

item.title: Australian Police Plan to Charge Suspect in Bondi Massacre
item.description: Officials said a father and son killed at least 15 people at a Jewish holiday celebration. More than three dozen others were hospitalized, including a...

item.title: U.S. Soldiers and Translator Killed in Syria Are Identified
item.description: The shooting attack in Palmyra, Syria, on Saturday struck Iowa National Guard troops. Two were killed, along with an American civilian interpreter; th...

item.title: Heng Guan Documented China’s Detention of Uyghurs. The U.S. Wants to Deport Him.
item.description: Heng Guan fled to the United States and released rare video evidence of China’s clampdown. His supporters say that sending him to Uganda puts him at r...

item.title: Jewish Community on Edge Following Bondi Beach Attack
item.description: Following a deadly shooting on Sunday, members of the Australian Jewish community have expressed anger toward the government over a failure to do enou...

item.title: Albanese Vows to Toughen Gun Laws After Deadly Bondi Shooting
item.description: The police said on Monday that they expected to bring criminal charges against the surviving suspect, who is in a coma after being shot by the police.

item.title: The Next Steps for Gaza
item.description: A cease-fire is mostly holding, But tough issues remain, including the fate of Hamas weapons.
